title: The Intelligent Scouting Archive
summary: Built a scouting assistant that centralizes hard-to-find European university basketball data. Mixed-method research informed a workflow that continuously discovers, enriches, and updates player records for recruiters.
highlights: AI prompt engineering for niche sources

hero.title: The Intelligent Scouting Archive
hero.subtitle: A personal project applying mixed-methods research to solve a real-world data challenge in sports analytics.

situation.title: The Situation: A Hidden Talent Pool
situation.description: While American collegiate sports are data-rich, European university basketball represents a significant, yet underserved, talent pool. Player information is often ephemeral, scattered across temporary tournament sites that are difficult to track. This "data obscurity" creates a significant challenge for scouts who rely on timely and accurate information.

methodology.title: 1. Qualitative Research: Understanding the User
methodology.description: Conducted in-depth interviews with basketball scouts to map their daily workflows and pinpoint their primary frustrations. The most time-consuming work was manual data collection—insight that became the cornerstone of the project.

methodology.title: 2. Quantitative Framework: Designing for Insight
methodology.description: Designed a data architecture that could support statistical analysis, including correlations between player stats and team performance. Structured the schema so findings translate into actionable recommendations.

methodology.title: 3. Technical Implementation: Building the Solution
methodology.description: Prototyped a full-stack workflow: a Tailwind CSS interface, Firebase for real-time data, and Google Gemini prompts tuned to parse niche sports sources.

results: Discovers and archives players from obscure sources.
Automatically enriches profiles with stats, summaries, and sources.
Continuously updates itself to ensure data freshness.
Provides a clean, user-friendly interface for scouts.
